title: Product Designer (UI)
description: Lounge is a real money P2P sports gaming platform that reduces payment friction & gameplay management by centralizing and automating a secure end-to-end process.We are looking for a talented product designer to elevate our wireframes. The MVP will focus on three key user journeys and include approximately 5-10 core screens. The application will primarily be a web app but with a strong emphasis on mobile optimization. Our team has already prepared medium-fidelity wireframes for each core screen. The immediate task at hand is to engage in a two-week design sprint focused on branding and creating high-fidelity designs for these screens. The final deliverable will be a fully designed MVP in Figma prepared for handoff to our development team.

title: Graphic Designer (Remote in Canada)
description:
Were looking for Canadas top graphic designers. If youre a super nice person + a super talented designer we should chat. And heres why:
Work from home full time
Full-time / salary position
Work with fun food & beverage brands
Benefits (Dental Vision Chiropractic etc.)
NO BAD CLIENTS - seriously were very selective about who we work with
Control your own schedule
Very few meetings = Spend all of your time doing creating work
Work in a fun creative start-up thats disrupting the industry
Work with people who respect and encourage work-life balance
Work and learn along side a team of 25+ worldclass designers
NO WORKING PAST 5 PM | NO WEEKENDS -> EVER
Immediate positions available in Jan. 2024
So heres who we are...DarkRoast Design is an innovative creative start-up engineered to provide high-performing food & beverage brands across North America access to top talent graphic designers.Based in Windsor Ontario we serve a diverse client base all across Canada and the United States.We are looking for experienced graphic designers who are versatile and able to work directly with clients on various design projects.Youll have the opportunity to work independently managing your own set of client portfolios and projects. Our designers who have demonstrated an ability to manage their schedules and deliver effectively are afforded the freedom to work wherever and however they are most productive.And youll be in a place where youre guaranteed to grow as a designer and creative professional. Our culture of constant learning and profesional development is second to none. Youll have the opportunity to learn and leverage cutting edge design tools and technologies.Youll learn more in 3 months working here than you would in years at any design school or work environment - we guarantee it :)TLDR - What we offer:The freedom and flexibility you would typically get from freelancing with the security and stability of a full-time salary and benefits. Inside an environment designed to help you constantly grow your skills and hone your craft.This is a remote/work from home position. But we are only hiring applications who live in Canada. Any applications from outside of Canada will be ignoredWhat were looking for:
Execute and manage design projects based on clients instructions
Collaborate directly with clients on managing revisions and project deliveries
Create and oversee the development of a range of branded materials/assets for various clients.
Extrapolate the clients vision and expectations based on limited information
Collaborate with marketing and creative teams to maximize the performance of design and iterate when necessary; able to adapt quickly to feedback
Foster a culture that thrives off of creativity curiosity and continuous learning
Who were looking for:
Min 4+ years of full time working experience (Freelancing Agency or In-house)
Must currently live in Canada**
Bonus* If you have experience working specifically with CPG Beverage eCommerce or Cannabis Brands
Effective time management skills
Able to work independently with minimal oversight
Strong communication skills
Graphic Design Degree and / or exceptional proven skills and experience in the field
Strong dynamic portfolio showcasing creativity and versatility.
Ability to multi-task and work cross-functionally with creative strategy and account executives.
Can approach projects with a “big picture” mindset and meticulous attention to detail.
Ability to develop compelling client-ready presentations and to be client-facing.
Working knowledge of Photoshop Illustrator and InDesign
This is a full-time salaried position.What we care about most is the quality of your work and personality. Dont have an updated resume? No problem. Just send us your portfolio and we can take it from there.

title: Product Designer
description:
About The Role:At Montra we’re working to create a magical video creation experience; in doing so design is at the centre of who we are. As our first product design hire youll work closely with our CEO to wireframe design and ultimately shape the user experience and interface beyond our initial MVP. You’ll have the autonomy to take risks and challenge the norms well beyond your typical video editor.What You’ll Do:
Work closely with our CEO to build upon our existing distinct product and brand guidelines
Own the design process from start to finish including wire-framing prototyping and developer walk-through
Frequently iterate on designs based on internal and external feedback
Simplify complex design problems into beautiful user experiences
Who You Are:Must Have
2-5 yrs of UI/UX design experience
Proficient in working collaboratively in Figma
Obsessed with crafting simple and gorgeous user experiences
A robust portfolio of past work/projects demonstrating your ascetic and abilities to simplify complex problems
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Great To Have
Deep interest in the future of video as a communication method and how we’ll build products that shape that future
Self-motivated person who can work individually and as part of a team
Experience in working in remote and in person teams
Ability to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic environment
How to Apply:At Montra we believe the best team members come from diverse backgrounds and bring unique experiences to work. We don’t care where you came from where you went to school or what you do. We simply care about your grit work ethic and passion for video as a mechanism for sharing ideas. While the makeup of our team is not all one and the same we are all bonded by our belief that a world where more people can create videos they’re proud of is a world we all want to live in. If that sounds like a world you want to help create we’d love to hear from you!

title: Mid-level Branding & Packaging Designer
description:
When you find yourself in Whole Foods or a specialty grocer do you often look up and realize you’ve been walking the aisles in a dream-like state for over an hour getting way too enthusiastic over a new beautiful package design you had to pick up? Or how about realizing you’re on vacation in a store soaking up all the innovative delicious snacks or beauty products you can’t wait to try while you know you have someone waiting in the car for you?Yeah us too. Welcome to Design Womb.We are a 13 year old small and intimate industry-leading full-service branding and packaging design agency that is woman-led and operated. We’re here to propel people & brands forward through the power of brand strategy and design towards a better beautiful life.Keep reading if you are aligned with our top values:• Autonomy• Resourcefulness• Fun • Curiosity (Lifetime learner)• Quality (Details are life)We’re hiring a full-time branding packaging and illustrative designer The best part? We’ve always been a remote-forward team serving clients across the country for 13+ years. While being local isn’t a requirement it is a “nice to have” for us. We currently keep PST hours with some flexibility around how that would work if you are not on the west coast with us.This is a salaried full time position.  Compensation is based on experience.  Vacation benefits and perks are included.- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -Let’s deliver big and have some fun while we do itAt Design Womb there is no job too big or small for you and you’re ready to roll up those sleeves to achieve results to help our clients and our studio succeed. We don’t hold you accountable simply for doing the work but rather for the results you create for the agency the client and yourself. You bring collaborative and enthusiastic “go-get-em” strategic thinking and a positive mindset to the table and you enjoy developing friendships and relationships with our small team and exciting clients.For this position you will work directly on creative studio projects primarily focused on branding and packaging where you will not only brainstorm and develop strategic design ideas and solutions but prove and execute your concepts and ideas through your design experience illustration skill set and industry knowledge required for this position.Your position may also include participating in brand strategy development sourcing packaging basic web design and designing collateral signage or conceptualizing for interior spaces or environments.You will work on projects for our existing or repeat clients that are seasoned professionals or dive into exciting new brand launches with new clients in food restaurant beauty cannabis wellness personal care or consumer CPG spaces that are built from the ground up for individuals and companies completely new to the game. You might be challenged with a line extension design or an established brand’s update or redesign where there’s a careful strategic solution between the old and the new to solve. We might also need you to dive into a quick smaller project or assist with a production job or researching vendors for a specific package substrate. You’ll be enthusiastic to develop projects and see your work produced and in stores. You’re okay with helping with the small stuff too all egos checked at the door.We are a smaller team so to start with most of the time you will be the one and only right hand human to our CEO and Chief Creative Director. You will interact directly with our 3rd party team of skilled contractors collaborators vendors and clients but you will report directly to our sole Founder/Creative Director during internal reviews for client work to collaborate develop and execute innovative & creative design or implement feedback with open arms passion and always on time.There may be times where we need you to work on internal projects as well though not a primary focus of this role the opportunities are likely to arise from time-to-time and enthusiasm to own some and see them through is welcome.- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -Attributes:
You value results and practicality. At the end of the day as a designer it’s not always just about a “pretty design” to you you realize clients are in business to make money and to sell products so our beautiful design has to stand out and deliver results. 
You have exceptional attention to detail in both design and managing your schedule organization and following up.
You’re ready to jump in at any or all of the stages involved in taking an idea to market from the get-go. No egos no hesitations no attitudes. We’re a brand incubator that can take an idea to market through branding and design so you have to be ready to cozy up with any step of the way.
You’re capable of working in an array of design “styles”(check out our work!) find enjoyment in doing so from one project to another can digest and take feedback well (not personally) and do not hold anything too precious about your work but definitely find pride in what you do. 
 You’re enthusiastic about the food beauty cannabis personal hygiene and wellness spaces. The names Ollipop Graza Safely Hu Kitchen Goodles or Malk don’t leave you googling them and you know the meaning of a dieline or The Dieline in our industry without being totally puzzled.
You catch yourself nerding out about fonts foundries and lettering and know that subtle differences in different typefaces and letterform personalities make all the difference in your own work.
You want to create new fresh future-forward work and you don’t get bogged down with personal aesthetic preferences what’s trending or trying to duplicate what everyone else has been doing.
You are knowledgeable about and understand how critical the importance of information and visual hierarchy is and how it might impact brand experience and buying decisions.
You want to grow and would excel as an in-house designer at a small and intimate agency (that’s also very successful). You love the idea of finding your work home. We’re looking for people that want to stick around and become part of the family helping us grow new offerings. If you want to freelance next year or are looking to quickly check a box on a certain industry experience to move on quickly you would be better suited to join our contractor pool below or to sign up for our newsletter with more to come on learning opportunities. https://designwomb.typeform.com/to/qlnncs9u
You 100% agree that communication is King/Queen. You aren’t shy and can be clear and direct ask questions and even laugh a little. You don’t take yourself too seriously and can take feedback and share it well. You have 0% beef or fear of working on your own with vendors teams and clients directly and you like making things happen.
You are open and collaborative on processes and flow of how an agency might work. You respect systems in place such as an internal review cadence and are also open to sharing insights to improve on them if you see the opportunity. This could involve sketching in early phases of design or working digitally quickly depending on the situation.
You are organized. Following a file naming scheme or flushed out process or system isn’t going to send you into a spiral and you are detailed with your email and your schedules. Extreme bonus if you dork out and love this king of stuff.
You are good at your own time management and meeting deadlines that you are comfortable setting on your own working with a team or a client. You have demonstrated the ability to prioritize and multi-task with ease and enthusiasm and you are experienced to know your own limits speed and scheduling capabilities.
You are decisive and can approach things with a subtle sense of urgency while remaining calm. You value the best solution over the easiest one and can work with discretion on confidential projects.
You can host a virtual video meeting pick up your phone to knock out a problem or lead a call like there’s no tomorrow. You know how to collaborate with excellent verbal and written communication skills both in person and digitally and completely comfortable doing it. We are a remote-forward agency. This is a non-negotiable.
You can work remotely or in person and remain productive in both scenarios and you don’t have a problem with facilitating project work for clients that are spread across the country while working remotely with them.
Since this is a remote role you enjoy and are okay working primarily solo/independant without an office. You don’t expect or require constant interaction and appreciate deep work time.
You have great interpersonal skills and strive off of establishing relationships and building rapport with clients and vendors. You enjoy getting to know your teammates on a friendly personal level and like a good story or laugh.

Dogs don’t freak you out.


Required Skills
Minimum 2-3+ years of graphic design with some packaging design experience at a creative agency studio or design shop.
Brainstorming and developing creative directions design strategy and “big ideas.”
 Branding identity logo design and iconography.
Illustration or or other artistic illustrative skills and experience digitizing this type of work.
Developing and delivering creative agency presentations (live or recorded).
Strong organizational time management and communication skills. (non-negotiable)
Ability to juggle multiple priorities at once or shift gears and remain flexible as deadlines may change or changes come in.
Packaging design knowledge and CPG experience.
Selecting sourcing and discovering fonts with an excellent typographic eye and strong layout skills. Hand lettering skills are a bonus.
Ability to execute mockups for packaging using sourced templates and/or photoshop skill sets.
Hands on print production experience. You know what a dieline is and know how to work with one from start to finish and/or you have experience sending things to commercial printers.
You know what the different Pantone books are and use them frequently.
Very Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite specifically Illustrator and Photoshop alongside other beneficial digital design tools such as iPad illustration skills Procreate etc.
Strong computer skills and general familiarity using tech and organizational tools we use in-house such as Basecamp Dropbox Google Drive/G Suite Slack Loom Miro etc.
Experience working in a creative agency or studio setting.
You aren’t afraid to speak up and ask questions.
The ability to facilitate your own work environment at a home office meaning you have the latest technology and equipment that will allow you to get started with executing the skills in this job listing. Some perks included.
Leading or participating in internal and external meetings either on the phone a video conference or in-person if applicable.
Collaborative team player mentality with go-getter/self-starter approach. Humble flexible with feedback  but ultimately the ability to generate your own work take ownership of things and lead a project without a lot of hand holding is a must.

Preferred Skills (but not required)

You live in California San Francisco the Bay Area or the West Coast. (though not required!)
Experience sourcing packaging vendors or suppliers and collecting bids and samples.
Website design or other digital experience (you may be doing some of this at times.)
Hand lettering or custom logotype design skills.
Art Direction of photography (planning and execution/on-set).
Photography or other related passions to design or the industries we work in.
Experience working with industry specific detailed nutritional fact panels ingredient lists certifications or  FDA USDA or TTB regulations. 
Following these required guides and learning or reading up on regulations for packaging doesn’t scare you. (If you have very specific experience with these things make sure you tell us but it’s not required though it will be a part of your role.)

You’re knowledgeable and curious about AI and how the tools of the future will enhance your work and work flow. (We’d love to hear what you’ve been experimenting with!)


When ApplyingHave your portfolio URL LinkedIn URL resume (PDF) and any relevant documentation such as a cover letter or other supporting documentation (PDF)  ready upon start. Instructions are provided.For more about Design Womb: designwomb.com- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Design Womb is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. U.S. Applicants. Must be legally allowed to work in the U.S.to apply.

title: Sr. Graphic Designer
description:
Our marketing team lives and breathes the IT ecosystem and speaks with data-driven marketing tactics. Utilizing video production events digital campaigns content design and vendor marketing we offer a full suite of marketing solutions that evolve with and lead the industry.About this role:The ideal Senior Graphic Designer will bring a mix of nuanced design skills to our internal creative agency. We are looking for an experienced artist who can inspire and be inspired by others to take our creative efforts to an award-winning level. The ideal candidate will have a natural eye for modern design a passion for delivering dynamic ideas that connect with any audience and a portfolio of work that proves it. *Please include your portfolio link on your resume.What youll do:
Designs and develops a wide range of TD SYNNEX marketing collateral using both digital and traditional methods and modern event theme concepts with expert attention to detail.
Acts as a leader and mentor to other designers and inspires the team with industry-leading creative excellence.
Collaborates with copywriters traffic managers and account managers to clarify objectives due dates and expected deliverables in a cost-effective and timely manner.
Presents design concepts in collaboration with supervisors to stakeholders and management.
Acts as a brand consultant helping to assure co-workers across the organization stay in compliance.
Stays up to date on modern design trends key technologies market and industry trends affecting company business segments.
Prioritizes work and provides project status reports at regularly scheduled checkpoints with manager or supervisor.
Contributes with the organization of TD SYNNEXs library of creative assets including images logos etc.
Ensures brand is communicated effectively in all marketing materials whenever possible.
What we’re looking for:
Bachelors Degree in position discipline preferred e.g. Marketing Graphic Design or Advertising plus four or more years relevant experience preferred.
Agency and corporate marketing experience preferred.
Demonstrates a mastery of design software and asset management applications used by design team and should be proficient in all Office applications.
What we offer:
401K employer match  
Paid Time-Off
Tuition reimbursement
Health Insurance                             
Opportunity for advancement  
Overtime opportunities

title: Senior Designer
description:
SpruceID is building a future where users own their identity and data across all digital interactions. Our open-source credentialing infrastructure is standards-compliant production-ready and extensible to typical enterprise and government IT systems. We’re a team of thoughtful nimble experts in open-sourced software development user experience and public policy. Transparency privacy and interoperability are hallmarks of our work. We are hiring a Sr. Designer to strategize and lead the design roadmap in collaboration with Product Marketing and Business Development. This role will be responsible for both creative and product design including user research and UX/UI. You will play a pivotal role in building best-in-class user experiences for digital identity applications that are adopted at scale across the United States and globally.Applicants to be considered for this role must be based in the United States.Responsibilities
Strategize and lead design roadmap effectively identifying and prioritizing opportunities across: Visual design (design systems) Interaction design (prototyping) Systems & information architecture research (qualitative & quantitative) and strategy (vision & product thinking)
Collaborate with Product to strategize  ideate and implement  user research product discovery and usability testing interviews
Research recommend and implement strategies for information architecture and user experiences across product designs and external collateral materials including website
Create iterate and maintain product interface designs (web and mobile applications) based on user feedback industry standards and best practices and customer requirements
Implement a cohesive brand design system across all external artifacts
Qualifications
Minimum 8 experience in all core aspects of Design including: Visual Design Interaction Design Systems & Information Architecture Research and Strategy
Experience designing mobile and web applications with 500K+ active usersFamiliar with best practices for usability and accessibility design for diverse populations
Proven success in Design at a fast-growing startup
Fluency with Figma and Webflow
Excellent written and verbal communication including both technical and non-technical topics
BonusExperience designing mobile wallet applicationsWe are passionate about cultivating a thriving culture of diverse individuals who bring unique perspectives to our mission. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race color ancestry religion sex national origin sexual orientation age citizenship marital status disability gender identity or Veteran status.

title: Senior Designer
description:
We are looking for a reliable creative and experienced senior web and UX designer with at least 5+ years of active experience.A designer we hire must understand current design trends why they exist and how they are used to drive conversion. The right designer would help us take on site mapping UX strategy web design and other graphic design needs for our clients. You must be familiar with brand guides typography color theory/strategy target audiences journey maps user flow mobile-first design responsive and adaptive design as well as building complete website mockups.
Remote work-from-home position
Eastern time zone location

Standard daytime business hour availability (Monday – Thursday 8-5 Friday 8–1)



The ideal designer needs to show real-world experience (work samples) regarding the following:
Web Design
Branding / Logo Design
Print / Digital Ad Design
Figma knowledge

Adobe Programs (Photoshop Illustrator and Indesign; knowledge of other Adobe CC programs a plus)


Strategic UX

Website Mockups / Prototypes conveying mobile responsiveness and interactive elements for client review


Providing organized detailed design files to web developers for coding
Experience with working REAL client provided content into beautiful designs planning for animations etc. and providing developers what they need.

Familiar with ADA compliance


The ideal candidate is:
Able to problem solve with common sense on a micro and macro level
Able and Experienced in confidently presenting designs to client offering validation and answering questions.
Able to proof their own work and catch errors before our team or clients do

Accountable with all facets of design while also being a team player





A fierce advocate for Oxford commas and great fonts!


Who We AreWe are a digital marketing company offering web design web development custom programming & web apps Google Ads management email marketing print design end-to-end campaigns and more. We have seen steady growth year over year since our beginning in 2009 and we have continued to build a dependable accountable positive fun core team.To be considered please send us the following:
Résumé
Work Samples
Salary Requirements
Please email to: hello@chariotcreative.com

title: Lead Designer
description:
Who we areParagonsDAO is a gamer and investor community focused on unleashing the potential of Web3 gamers. We’re trailblazing the Web3 gaming ecosystem by reducing barriers-to-entry for traditional gamers making playable assets accessible to all offering education and coaching igniting the competitive landscape and building innovative Web3 and GameFi solutions. Our team are enthusiastic builders engineers designers storytellers and industry veterans united by a love for gaming and a commitment to excellence in eight core values: Trust Self-Awareness Open Communication Positive Default Accountable Freedom Fun Respect and Integrity.SummaryWe are seeking a dynamic and autonomous Design Lead who will be accountable for overseeing and delivering designs related to our products website UX/UI while overseeing design work related to brand graphic design and marketing collateral. This role will closely partner with Product Marketing/Communications and Community/Education teams working closely with stakeholders across several geographies in both an advisory and delivery capacity. As a small team we all expect everyone to be flexible agile and add value outside of their core role expectations. The candidate should be equally comfortable designing in styles suitable to gaming DeFi (decentralized finance) and SAAS products. The role requires a primary day-to-day focus in Product and UX design with accountability and oversight for brand and graphic design. The candidate should be able to flexibly shift contexts between different types of design and comfortably work within different brand identities while creating appropriate connections between them (e.g. our two properties ParagonsDAO.com and Priming.xyz). The role is supported by a Junior Designer (whose primary strength is graphic design) and will be expected to delegate appropriate work to them review and provide coaching feedback. The role is also expected to seek out and manage temporary contractors as needed based on workload and skills required to deliver on stakeholder needs.Key Responsibilities
UX/UI design related to ParagonsDAO’s website and products (including new features of Priming.xyz our upcoming player management system a potentially revamping a Staking page to suit a new smart contract optimizing treasury dashboard etc.). 
Working closely with front-end developers to implement UX/UI designs.
Oversee maintain and influence the branding/visual identities of ParagonsDAO and related properties (including Priming.xyz)
Oversee graphic design to support all marketing campaigns and collateral ranging from product features to tournaments to GameFi solutions to semi-annual reports and more. 
Close partnership and collaboration with Product Marketing/Communications and Community/Education teams.
Manage all design projects and tasks in our project management software for clear visibility on progress status priorities and workload
Delegate to and oversee all work completed by Junior Designer (and any future design resources) providing appropriate guidance and coaching where required.
Identify seek out delegate to and oversee all design-related work completed by temporary contractors.
Own and optimize all design-focused processes (e.g. creative brief/design request process).
Identify opportunities to improve status quo and show strong initiative both within and outside areas of expertise. 
Requirements
5+ years experience
Proficient in Figma (including prototyping) and Adobe Creative Suite.
Proficiency in UX and product design.
Understanding of front-end developer needs and partnership including design systems component states and custom interactions.
Strong familiarity and ability to oversee resources related to branding and graphic design.
Strong portfolio demonstrating a wide range of design skills.
Ability to manage several projects simultaneously.
Ability to work with minimal oversight and collaborate with a team.

The ideal candidate:

Is a gamer.
Is a Web3 advocate.
Has a close personal connection with the game Parallel (the game which a majority of our efforts are currently focused on).



Other “nice to have” skills include experience with delivering or overseeing:

Motion graphics.
Video editing. 
Streaming setups.


Contract DetailsThis is a full-time contractual position managed by Game Cove LLC a US-based development company operating on behalf of ParagonsDAO. RemunerationPay will be within the posted pay range and will depend on the successful applicant’s skills and experience.Compensation will be paid in USDC (a cryptocurrency pegged to the US dollar) with an option to receive a percentage in PDT (ParagonsDAO’s governance token). Role may be eligible for additional discretionary team-based incentives paid in PDT.

title: SENIOR ART DIRECTOR Licensed Apparel
description:
This position manages the production artist team and oversees all art development + execution from end to end for all licensed product collections including factory communication.POSITION OVERVIEW:Gameday Couture is a well-established manufacturer of officially licensed college and professional sports apparel for women. With a strong presence in the market with over 400 college and pro licenses and as a proud Mark Cuban Company we take pride in delivering products that resonate with our audience and uphold the integrity of the licensed brands we work with.We are seeking a highly motivated skilled and most importantly hands on Senior Art Director to join our team and lead the GRAPHIC ART production workflow for our licensed apparel collections as well as efficiently manage the workflow calendar for our creative/graphics department. As the Senior Art Director with your expert knowledge of graphic design principles you will lead and execute our creative initiatives while driving expert-level efficiency in Adobe Illustrator Adobe Photoshop and leveraging scripts automations and Ai technology to enhance our graphics production.The successful candidate for this role must be adept at working in a fast-paced environment especially as we are entering an exciting new phase of growth. The Senior Art Director should thrive under pressure be comfortable with rapid changes and tight deadlines and possess the ability to adapt swiftly to emerging opportunities and challenges. As we are experiencing a surge in business and venturing into new horizons the Senior Art Director will play a pivotal role in driving the creative/graphics team to deliver high-quality results at an accelerated pace. The ideal candidate will exhibit a strong sense of urgency resourcefulness and resilience ensuring that the creative process remains efficient and effective even during periods of rapid expansion. This individual should possess a passion for embracing innovation staying ahead of industry trends and inspiring the team to achieve excellence while preserving the creative standards that define our brand. Working collaboratively with cross-functional teams the Senior Art Director will lead with enthusiasm and a growth-oriented mindset energizing the team to seize the opportunities that arise during this thrilling phase of the companys growth trajectory.***An interest in and/or knowledge of team sports particularly NCAA NFL and MLS is required.****Clear track record of hands on management - non negotiable****Knowledge of the female consumer - non negotiableRESPONSIBILITIES:
Fast-Paced Leadership: Thrive in a fast-paced startup-like environment leading both internal and external graphic artists with agility adaptability and a focus on high-volume output.
Artwork Design Expertise: Exhibit an expert-level proficiency in Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop guiding the team in creating outstanding apparel graphic artwork designs that align with our vision and resonate with sports fans.
Scripting and Automation: Utilize your experience with scripts automations and explore/adopt the latest Ai technology to streamline and optimize graphics production processes enhancing productivity and quality.
End-to-End Collection Management: Oversee the entire creative process for all graphics on our licensed products from concept development to final product release ensuring efficient execution and adherence to strict deadlines.
Hands-On Execution: Lead by example and actively participate in the creative process and execution of graphics contributing your skills to the development of artwork designs and product concepts.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate cross-functionally with various teams including marketing product development and licensing to understand project requirements establish timelines and deliver exceptional results by ensuring there is a strong aligned 360 design approach.
Team Empowerment: The team is small but mighty. We are looking for the Senior Art Director to foster a collaborative and innovative work environment empowering the creative/graphics team to achieve their full potential while maintaining high-quality standards.
Talent Sourcing: Actively source and acquire top creative talent to join our fast-paced startup-like environment building a diverse and skilled team capable of delivering outstanding officially licensed apparel.
Organization & Process Cleanup: With growth things can get messy we need the Senior Art Director to take charge and produce maintain and update creative files specifications documentation presentations etc. to ensure files and SOP’s stay up to date and easy to find.
Drive a close cooperation with designers from other product area (Footwear & Accessories) to ensure strong aligned 360 design concepts
Audience-Centric Approach: Drive the team to produce artwork designs that deeply connect with our target audience and the diverse fan culture associated with each sports team.
Licensing Compliance: Collaborate closely with the licensing division to ensure all designs meet brand guidelines and licensing requirements for licensed apparel.
Factory Communication: Efficiently communicate with manufacturing partners to ensure proper embellishment of garments maintaining high quality standards expert-level efficiency and meeting market demands. Ensure communications stay on track to confirm all deadlines are met.
Workflow Improvements: Develop and optimize workflows and processes to improve efficiency productivity and collaboration within the creative team.
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelors degree in design fine arts or a related field. Equivalent work experience will also be considered.
Proven experience (5 years) in a leadership role within a creative/graphics design department for an apparel or licensed product company with a strong focus on licensed artwork project management and team management.
Proven Experience/Leadership: Demonstrated success in leading and managing a creative team in a fast-paced and high-growth environment driving excellence and efficiency.
Hands-On Approach: A willingness to be hands-on in the creative process and execution providing guidance and working collaboratively with the team to achieve outstanding results.
Adobe Creative Suite Expertise: Expert-level proficiency in Adobe Illustrator and Adobe Photoshop with the ability to showcase mastery in producing top-quality artwork designs.
Scripting and Automation Experience: Experience in leveraging scripts automations and Ai technology to optimize graphics production and streamline workflows.
Apparel Industry Knowledge: In-depth understanding of the apparel manufacturing processes execution of production art for apparel trends relevant to Pro and College League apparel with either a significant knowledge of sports team logos (specifically NCAA NFL MLS) or specific knowledge/experience directly with the sports licensing industry.
Time/Project Management: Exceptional organizational skills to effectively manage multiple projects and people meet strict deadlines and handle competing priorities in a high-volume environment.
***Passion for Sports: A genuine passion for NCAA NFL and MLS sports and a dedication to producing apparel that captures the spirit of these teams.GC + SOHO BRANDS LLCCOMPANY OVERVIEW:Gameday Couture + Social House (GC + SOHO Brands LLC) are two brands under one House playing a game-changing role in the online women’s apparel shopping and social experience.GAMEDAY COUTURE – THE BRANDGameday Couture is an independent brand steeped in the independent traditions of sports and its fans. We make premium officially licensed apparel that defies seasons and represent some of the most iconic sports powerhouses. Proudly one of the first Female-owned and Female-Led companies to produce thoughtfully designed and ethically sourced female-focused fan apparel. Our highly curated collections celebrate and exemplify the culture style and authenticity of every campus sport or team we represent. Premium fabrics expert styling and thoughtful design. Gameday Couture – Modern Sports Fashion.SHOP THE SOHO – THE BRAND:WELCOME TO SHOP THE SOHO - The Social House of modern curated fashion from premium independent brands.Style strategy is the cornerstone of a curated closet. But we believe a curated style should be inspiring not overwhelming. We design for authenticity and for style that’s effortless with collections that help people make more reflected decisions with confidence. We are committed to offering thoughtful choices thoughtful design responsible sourcing and fostering the connection of both our online and offline communities. It’s our never ending pursuit to provide access to a community driven social marketplace of curated style that reflects your personal experiences your passions your taste and personality.OUR HISTORY:Gameday Couture was established in 2010 as a manufacturer of officially licensed women’s college apparel. In 2014 the brand had the privilege of striking a deal with Billionaire Mark Cuban on ABC’s Shark Tank. Today the brand continues to create fashion-forward women’s licensed and private label apparel holds over 400 NCAA MLS & NFL pro league licenses and is distributed through both B2B and D2C channels in over 2500 stores nationwide.Remote Position Info:With employees across the country we operate generally under CST time zones for regular business communication hours. We are a highly collaborative team environment in particular as we are experiencing significant growth at this time. Daily/Standard use of communication and organization tools such as Slack + GSuite or Google Calendars are required by all team members.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
WedLuxe an established luxury wedding media brand and design agency is looking for a talented creative and trend-aware Graphic Designer  to join the team.  Above all this position requires a detail-oriented designer with a pretty feminine design sensibility. Were in the business of marketing luxury wedding professionals and hotels and resorts  through content marketing. We reach over a million people a year with print magazines digital and social channels and WedLuxe-branded events. Through our agency division we also provide award-winning graphic design and content creation services for clients including event professionals five-star hotels and tourism boards. Our ideal team member enjoys the idea of being immersed in the world of luxury weddings from around the world (obviously!) and most importantly will have an innate ability to adapt and further develop the WedLuxe brand aesthetic. Your professional portfolio (or personal design projects) should showcase your expertise and appreciation for typography and clearly prove youve got a trendhunter personality that loves to do a visual deep-dive into pop culture fashion floral interior design art and design from historical eras. In broad strokes we hope to find a fellow design aficionado with a penchant for pretty things! If this sounds like you youre comfortable conceptualizing or designing beautiful moodboards social media graphics real wedding layouts coffee table books monograms brand kits or websites (using platforms like Showit or Squarespace). Written communication skills are a BIG part of this job because most of what you design requires extra attention to spelling and the ability to describe your concepts with words in addition to your visuals. Were a small but mighty team so you should enjoy working in a boutique team environment where everyone is required to self-manage their time while demonstrating excellent customer service skills and a team-player attitude. Client-facing communication and natural customer service skills are also important. To apply please prepare a portfolio that showcases a cross-section of pretty design projects. If youre so inclined wed love to see a sample moodboard or two of your favorite current trends whether they be interior design graphic design or luxury wedding-related.REQUIREMENTS
Feminine luxurious design style and sensibility 
3-5 years of hands-on professional design experience (or if youre a new grad create a portfolio of pretty samples to show us youre ready for the challenge!)
Comfortable presenting ideas and designs to coworkers or clients

Bachelors degree or diploma in graphic design from a recognized program


Well organized responsible and dedicated with the ability to work on multiple projects at one time and deliver refined designs in a short time
Great time management skills
Deadline driven
Website design experience whether its from SHOWIT Squarespace Webflow or Wordpress 
Understanding of print production 
Extremely detailed and accuracy-oriented
Able to receive constructive criticism in design critiques
Proficiency with the Adobe Creative Suite including InDesign Photoshop Illustrator 
Canva skills (who would have guessed Canva could be a tool for real designers but we love it!) 
Demonstrated awareness of the principles of excellent typography 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
SALARY RANGE: $50000 to $70000 Dependent on level of experience and range of skills.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
Senior Product Designer at TeamBridgeAbout TeamBridge: TeamBridge is revolutionizing the workforce management landscape with its state-of-the-art composable platform. Funded by General Catalyst we are at the forefront of creating flexible efficient and intuitive solutions for complex workforce challenges. Our mission is to create technology that empowers the 80% of the worlds teams who have been left behind recent innovations. Based in SF TeamBridge  is a team committed to redefining each industry we partner with.About the Candidate: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Product Designer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be a critical thinker and a passionate doer looking to have real impact from their efforts. You should have a proven track record of delivering exceptional visual components and highly usable platform designs even when crafting complex solutions.Basic Requirements:
Degree: We dont care. We care about the quality of your work and the thoughtfulness of your efforts.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in product design with a focus on digital products.
Strong portfolio showcasing expertise in UI/UX design interaction design and visual design.
Proficiency in design tools such as Figma or similar.
Experience in working with customers or customer research process with a focus on deliverables and results.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills with a knack for presenting design concepts and prototypes.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Location: This position is based in San Francisco and requires hybrid in-person collaboration.Opportunity to Work with Industry Leaders: As a Senior Product Designer at TeamBridge you will have the unique opportunity to work alongside two of the worlds most prominent product design founders known for their significant contributions to Ubers design team Arjun and Tito will work closely with this role to help accelerate your career and deliver results for our customers. This is a rare chance to learn from the best gain invaluable insights and make a tangible impact in the field of product design.Join TeamBridge and be a part of a visionary company thats shaping the future of workforce management.

title: Senior Graphic Designer - Fōcl Studio
description:
About us: Fōcl Studio is a creative full-service branding agency specialising in the property development and lifestyle industries. Due to continued growth we have a newly created role for a creative motivated Senior Graphic Designer to join our team based in Burleigh Heads. *** Please send your resume to hello@focl.com.au ***About the role:We are seeking an individual who wants to have the ability to create work for a variety of clients projects and industries. The ideal candidate will have strong creative skills and a portfolio of work which demonstrates their passion for design. This candidate will have experience in working with numerous different design platforms such as digital and print forms. Previous experience working on real estate / property development projects is highly regarded but not essential. This is a full-time remote role.About You:
Creative reliable with a broad skill set utilising modern design techniques.
Ability to project manage your client work. Being highly organised is a necessity.
Ability to work collaboratively with the marketing team
Fluent written and spoken English
Create result driven solutions and have a proven track record in executing designs to brief.
Have a clear understanding and ability to implement creative and marketing strategy in your designs.
An understanding of social media strategy.
Responsibilities:
Create compelling and result driven designs for a vast range of clients and internal company collateral.
Working knowledge of UI/UX
Collaborate with the team to ensure consistency of designs across various media outlets.
Maintain awareness of current industry and technology standards social media competitive landscape and market trends.
Produce and develop marketing material including (social media EDMs print event product social campaigns full branding suite brochures websites etc).
Scope and document the process of your client work.
Work on platforms such as Klavyio or Mailchimp and develop new creative for EDMs.
Cutting and uploading of video content for website and social media.
Liaise and assist in pitching new clients.
Liaise and manage relationships with videographers photographers and web designers.
Requirements:
3+ years of experience in graphic design
Portfolio of work
Previous experience of working with web developers
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite including InDesign Photoshop Illustrator Premier Pro and Acrobat
Strong communication conceptual thinking typography skills and design skills
Knowledge of social media platforms (Instagram Facebook TikTok and Pinterest)
Thorough understanding of graphic design trends and best practice
Demonstrates effective time management and organizational skills
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
A high attention to detail 
Ability to work independently and on multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to meet daily goals and deadlines
Ability to effectively contribute to brainstorming and other idea generation activities

title: Graphic Designer
description: Shakespeare Theatre Company seeks a Graphic Designer to join our Marketing and Communications team. The Graphic Designer works with the Senior Director of Marketing and Communications to maintain the creative direction for STC and its communication vehicles including production identities print advertising direct mail electronic communications video and web assets. The Graphic Designer also maintains STC’s visual brand designing and managing multiple creative and design projects in support of STC including key art for upcoming productions. This is a full-time position with excellent benefits and an annual salary of $52000 - $54000.The successful candidate will have a Bachelor’s degree in graphic design or a related visual arts degree with 2-4 years graphic design experience and expertise in Photoshop Illustrator InDesign and After Effects or Premiere Pro. Experience working with printers web developers and photographers is preferred but not essential. Please note that this position is hybrid with three days per week on-site.Shakespeare Theatre Company is committed to building an inclusive equitable and anti-racist organization that better reflects the community where we reside and work. To learn more about our on-going efforts and to read our Anti-Racist Action Plan please visit https://www.shakespearetheatre.org/about/equity-diversity-inclusion/. If you are interested in this position please apply on our website at http://www.shakespearetheatre.org/about/careers-and-casting/jobs/ or you may send a cover letter resume and references to employment@shakespearetheatre.org.

title: B2B Senior Art Director
description:
UTTR is on the prowl for a standout full-time B2B senior art director. Do you have the ability to create images that not only look great but also speak volumes? Let’s combine your creative genius with our dynamic team.Responsibilities:
Client Sync: Get to the heart of the clients needs by understanding their mission audience and goals. Align visions and start creating
Unwavering Quality: You consistently deliver top-notch designs that fit the clients brand
Business basics: Recognize how your designs lead to tangible results. It is more than just art; it’s a strategy
B2B Lens: Adhere to B2B standards ensuring your work stands tall in the professional world
Team Dynamics: Understand the essence of each UTTR department. Boost our impact with collaborative creativity
Evolve and refine: Take insights from previous projects and apply that knowledge to improve your future projects
Test Optimize Repeat: Establish a cycle of continuous improvement. Every pixel has the potential to be slightly better
QA Before Launch: Every piece you send out is triple-checked to ensure perfection

Tech Innovations: Embrace new tech tools that can enhance your creative abilities


Project Management: Handle projects with precision ensuring timely delivery and keeping everyone in the loop‍
Client Expectations:
Deep Dives: Understand the clients audience objectives and brand essence intimately
Quality Assured: Deliver striking designs that reflect the clients brand spirit

Collaborative Strategy: Understand the synergy between UTTR teams and use creativity to improve client outcomes‍


Creative Development:
B2B Best Practices: Maintain alignment with B2B design benchmarks
Data-Driven Decisions: Analyze what works and what doesn’t. Allow numbers to inspire your creativity
Historical Insights: Past projects have stories. Listen learn and leverage
Continuous Refinement: Never settle. Test tweak and transform your creatives
Tech Integration: Keep an eye out for new tools that can help you fine-tune your creations‍
Project & Client Management:
Organization of tasks through timely delivery - no tasks are overdue. If timelines are an issue this is clearly stated when the ticket is made.

Have all creative QA’d before setting live.‍


Why Make Waves at UTTR?
Global Flexibility: We’re everywhere virtually. Choose your workspace
Cultural Diversity: Join a team as varied as the designs we create
Flexi-Fridays: Additional days off; just for you
Sky’s the Limit: We’re a startup. Every day is a growth opportunity
Innovative Clients: Collaborate with a variety of startups to keep your designs fresh‍
Got the creative spark were looking for? Let’s create magic together!

title: Art Director
description:
Job Description:Are you obsessed with data partner success taking action and changing the game? If you have a whole lot of hustle and a touch of nerd come work with Pattern! We want you to use your skills to push one of the fastest-growing companies in the US to the top of the list.Pattern is the premier partner for global Ecommerce acceleration and is headquartered in Utahs Silicon Slopes tech hub—with offices in Asia Australia Europe the Middle East and North America. Valued at $2 billion Pattern has been named one of the fastest growing tech companies in North America by Deloitte and one of best-led companies in America by Inc. More than 100 global brands—like Nestle Sylvania Kong Panasonic Sorel Skullcandy and Popsockets—rely on Patterns global Ecommerce acceleration platform to scale their business around the world. We place employee experience at the center of our business model and have been recognized as one of Americas Most Loved Workplaces®.We need an Art Director to lead development and execution of amazing Ecommerce brand strategies for our partners. This role requires a discerning eye and understanding of overall brand strategy including everything from product photos videos web design packaging to pitching ideas to brand executives. If you’re already an art director or an experienced Senior Graphic Designer looking for the next amazing step in your career we encourage you to apply! This is a full-time role and will work a hybrid schedule based in Lehi Utah.An online portfolio is required to apply for this position. Please include a link to your portfolio on your resume.Frequently Asked QuestionsWhat is a day in the life of an Art Director?
Design awesome work within client’s style guides
Work with the creative team to execute a visual concept through final production
Present work to creative team bringing a strong design point of view
Own large scale projects independently
Create presentation materials to confidently pitch your concept to clients
Be involved with photoshoot/photography/shot list/production/styling etc.

Lead and mentor junior team members to help them build their design skills


What will I need to thrive in this role?
BFA degree in Graphic Design or related field
4-7 years of progressive professional graphic design work at least 2 years in a senior role
Advanced typography skills are a must
Proficient with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop  Illustrator & InDesign) Google Suite and MS Office (Word Excel PowerPoint)
Attention to detail with emphasis on accuracy quality and organization
Excellent communication presentation and interpersonal skills
Ability to handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment

Styling interest or experience is a bonus 


What does high performance look like?
You follow through with all assignments in a timely manner
You give 100% to all tasks and projects you are given
You actively comment and participate in group collaborations
You embrace autonomy take full ownership of your projects and follow through to completion
You work well within the bounds of client’s style guides

You have a passion for design and creative problem solving  


What is my potential for career growth?This role will provide opportunities for professional growth and networking. We love to promote internally and have several opportunities for growth within our company.What does success look like in the first 30 60 90 days?30 Days - You are familiar with your brand partners’ needs you have established great relationships with your team members and a comfortable workflow60 Days - You have coordinated your team’s efforts and pitched ideas to brand partners90 Days - You hold regular sessions with each of your team members for mentorship and development you have received and implemented feedback from your brand partners you have contributed to revenue growth via optimized creative assetsWhat is the team like?You will work with the other full-time Art Directors Graphic Designers Photo and Video Directors and members of our creative team. You will also be mentored by the Chief Creative Officer and meet with them on a regular basis to discuss your performance. This team is data driven and results oriented. You will collaborate regularly with members of your team and partner executives to implement actionable solutions. Ideas and input are encouraged from all members.Sounds great! What’s the company culture?We are looking for individuals who are:
Game Changers- A game changer is someone who looks at problems with an open mind and shares new ideas with team members regularly reassesses existing plans and attaches a realistic timeline to goals makes profitable productive and innovative contributions and actively pursues improvements to Pattern’s processes and outcomes.
Data Fanatics- A data fanatic is someone who recognizes problems and seeks to understand them through data draws unbiased conclusions based on data that lead to actionable solutions and continues to track the effects of the solutions using data.
Partner Obsessed- An individual who is partner obsessed clearly explains the status of projects to partners and relies on constructive feedback actively listens to partner’s expectations and delivers results that exceed them prioritizes the needs of your partners and takes the time to create a personable experience for those interacting with Pattern.

Team of Doers- Someone who is a part of a team of doers uplifts team members and recognizes their specific contributions takes initiative to help in any circumstance actively contributes to supporting improvements and holds themselves accountable to the team as well as to partners.


What is the hiring process?
Initial phone interview with Pattern’s talent acquisition team
Video interview with a hiring manager
Onsite interview with a panel of department leaders
Professional reference checks
Executive review

Offer


How can I stand out as an applicant?
Be prepared to talk about professional accomplishments with specific data to quantify examples
Be ready to talk about how you can add value and be the best addition to the team
Focus on mentioning how you would be partner obsessed at Pattern

Be prepared to talk about any side projects related to data and analytics


Why should I work at Pattern?Pattern offers big opportunities to make a difference in the Ecommerce industry! We are a company full of talented people that evolves quickly and often. We set big goals work tirelessly to achieve them and we love our Pattern community. We also believe in having fun and balancing our lives so we offer awesome benefits that include
Unlimited PTO
Paid Holidays
Onsite Fitness Center
Company Paid Life Insurance
Casual Dress Code
Competitive Pay
Health Vision and Dental Insurance

401(k)


Pattern is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Payzli Website Re-Design
description:
At Payzli were redefining the financial tech space – not just any payment processor but a digital revolution leader. Were looking for a visionary web designer whos ready to set the digital world ablaze with us. Your mission: to transform Payzli.com into a digital odyssey a beacon of innovation in the fintech universe.The Mission:
Authority & Innovation: Were not just in the game; were changing it. Your design should reflect our status as fintech trailblazers.
User Experience Masterclass: From the first click to the final conversion every element must be a seamless intuitive journey towards action.
Futuristic Design: Envision a website thats not just a page but an experience – where cutting-edge visuals meet interactive brilliance.
Mastering Conversions: We envision a website where every click scroll and keystroke is a strategic step towards that pivotal sign up moment. Your design should streamline the user journey making it irresistibly easy and appealing for visitors to take action. Envision a frictionless intuitive pathway that naturally guides users to commit turning casual browsing into profitable conversions.
The Team:Join us the disruptors the dreamers the digital daredevils at Payzli. Were seeking a design hero whos not afraid to push the envelope explore the uncharted and breathe life into pixels.The Opportunity:
Make Your Mark: This is your chance to shine on a high-profile stage. Payzli is aligned with top names in the fintech world – your design will be at the forefront of this dynamic industry.
More Than Just Compensation: Sure theres a competitive reward but the real prize? Your design will be the face of a platform revolutionizing financial technology for millions.
Your Challenge:
Showcase Your Genius: Forget the mundane. We want to see your prototypes your creative experiments – anything that screams next-gen designer.
Brand Consistency: Dive into our Payzli Brand Deck understand our ethos and bring it to life.
The Reward: One visionary will embark on a journey to redesign our entire website – a chance to become a legend in the fintech design world.Are you the design prodigy we seek? If you breathe innovation and your designs whisper the future we want you. Show us your magic and let’s shape the future together!Visit payzli.com for inspiration and let your creativity run wild. Were eager to witness the future of web design – through your eyes.

title: Visual / Product designer
description:
We are a boutique Product Design studio working with a select group of SaaS clients to design their products and scale design operations. Embracing a fully remote working model we prioritize work-life balance and creativity. Our approach is anti-micromanagement and we strive to minimize meetings whenever possible. Our primary goal is to deliver aesthetically pleasing and exceptionally user-friendly interfaces.Role Description + RequirementsThis is a full-time remote role for a mid/sr-level Product Designer with a strong focus on visual design. We would start on a short contract basis (fixed days part-time or full-time whichever you prefer) before committing to full-time.Requirements:
Youre an expert in Figma - you spend most of your time there and know the main keyboard shortcuts.
Interface design - making that button pop and making sure the now-perfect UX design looks beautiful.
Visual identity and visual design - creating stunning elements for web and mobile apps: onboarding pages illustrations navigation icons.
User experience design - developing quick wireframes mockups user flows storyboarding and prototyping
Ability to speak English Lithuanian not required
BONUS - not required You can design beautiful websites on Figma and/or Framer.
BONUS - not required Branding: visual identity logo design branding elements
Dont apply if:
you havent done a mobile or web app design before.
youre a graphic designer or illustrator without UX/UI design experience.
youre an industrial product designer (not tech).
you dont speak basic English.
your online communication is poor
you dont have the discipline to work on tasks without micromanagement.
you like to spend the first 3 hours of your day scrolling on your phone.
Benefits
Fully remote - no limitations as long as the work is done. Work from a beach in Thailand a coffee shop or at your apartment.
Almost no communication with the client
Work on innovative designs: We already have a big and customisable design system so you wont need to recreate the same elements.
Work with tech companies that appreciate good design.
No micromanagement
Basically no meetings
Well teach you everything we know about design scaling working fast dealing with clients and building amazing SaaS products.
Full creative freedom
Budget for home office / co-working / education.
SalaryGross(before taxes) 3000-6000/mo depending on the experience level. Quick salary increases if youre very productive.How to apply
Fill out this super-short Google form: https://forms.gle/Fm7ieMJXZCUE85ry8
We only judge based on your design skills
If youre not sure youre good enough - try applying nothing bad will happen!:)
Dont contact us directly we will review all candidates
Dont book calls with us we will blacklist you for that.

title: Indie Game Studio Seeks Art Director
description: tl;drWe are looking for an art director to oversee production of character and environment assets for our isometric pixel art game.job descriptionEverything is in Notion! https://min-max.notion.site/Art-Director-ca16c4b10c8446eea82cc7c93943e0a2applyingBut please apply via Upwork.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Nanonets is a startup headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area solving real-world business problems with cutting-edge machine learning. We are backed by prestigious investors from Silicon Valley such as Y-Combinator SV Angels and Elevation Capital. Our product automates complex business processes involving unstructured data using deep-learning to convert it into a structured format and connect multiple applications with each other all in an automated manner..We are looking for a Product Designer proficient in crafting intuitive interfaces for our web application. Your role involves engaging directly with our users to understand their pain-points ensuring a seamless and user-friendly experience in every interaction.Responsibilities:* Collaborate with product managers and analysts to gather and assess user needs.* Conduct interviews with customers to identify pain points and map out user journeys.* Effectively present design ideas to developers and stakeholders.* Identify and resolve UX issues.* Create mockups and prototypes to demonstrate feature functionality and appearance.* Convert wireframes into detailed UI designs.* Maintain and develop a cohesive design language system for our core product.What We’re Looking For:* Minimum 3 years in a Product Design or similar role (UX/UI Design).* A portfolio of work displaying high quality user experience-focused design and problem-solving.* Strong understanding of User-Centered Design Processes Design Principles and Systems.* Proficiency in design and wireframing tools (e.g. Figma).* Excellent communication skills to clearly convey ideas to stakeholders.* Strong time-management skills with a proactive approach to meeting goals efficiently.

title: Marketing Designer (Remote & Freelance)
description:
BRYTER a fast-growing B2B SaaS company is looking for a talented and creative designer to join our Marketing Team on a freelance remote basis. BRYTER provides legal and compliance professionals with the tools to automate workflows and turn their expert knowledge into digital applications. BRYTER offers two products: an AI powered policy management solution and a no-code automation platform. We’re looking for a skilled designer to elevate our brand presence and deliver compelling visual assets that resonate with our target audience. BRYTER was named Leading Legal Technology Company of the Year by the Financial Times listed as one of the top 100 European B2B soonicorns by Sifted and one of the hottest startups by Wired.   At BRYTER we are remote-first with office hubs in London Frankfurt and New York. Being remote-first means we have invested a lot in creating our own cultural reality: one that places our team members at the center of everything. Being remote-first means we have a diverse encouraging and hands-on culture and we are looking for a bright high-energy individual with a passion to learn and contribute to the success of the company as a whole.   Being a Marketing Designer with us As a remote freelance Marketing Designer at BRYTER you will play a key role in developing and executing visually engaging marketing materials. Working closely with others in the Marketing Team (Content Demand Generation Technical Website Manager) you will contribute to creating a creative engaging and consistent brand identity across various channels – from paid social campaigns to e-books and webpages. You are a high-energy designer who enjoys the challenges and opportunities B2B marketing presents. In a world of boring stock photos you like to be the one creating a visual aesthetic that pushes boundaries and brings fun energy and creativity into B2B Marketing (and to the legal and compliance industries!) while doing so in a way consistent with the brand. In this role you will report directly to the VP of Marketing and work closely with the founders and the Product Design team as the person responsible for the visual aesthetic of the BRYTER brand. What you’ll do
Develop engaging and visually striking assets to support marketing efforts across platforms and channels: paid social media campaigns collateral (e.g. e-books and PDFs) presentations and landing pages.
Create elements for our website and landing pages.
Work closely with others in the Marketing Team: Content Demand Generation and our Technical Website Owner as well as cross-functionally (Product Design) and directly with the founders to create assets that support our Marketing Strategy.
Manage and execute on multiple projects deadlines and communication in a fast-moving start-up environment.
 What we’re looking for·       A strong portfolio that shows your visual design skills.·       2+ years in marketing design roles (or similar).·       The ability to bring energy and creativity to a traditional industry (Legal/ Compliance and B2B).·       Digital and print expertise: trained in creating assets for both digital and print mediums.·       Strong communication skills both written and verbal.·       Fluent English speaker   What is it like to work at BRYTER? We are a remote-first Software-as-a-Service company with people across UK Europe and the USA. We believe that teams are more important than businesses and we are convinced that the right team can have the greatest impact. Our management team has successfully built scaled and sold companies before and wants to create an environment where everyone can grow to their full potential and flourish.  We want our team members to take responsibility to understand the mission and ultimately to be happy. That is why our organization is optimized to foster employee happiness allowing everyone to have as much ownership autonomy and mastery as possible. If you want to hear it straight from the horse’s mouth on what this means how working at BRYTER is like our CPO and Co-Founder Michael Hübl has recorded a webinar where he shares a bit about our remote-first working culture.  Being remote-first means we work extra hard to foster relationships including weekly check-ins at a team and company level and an in-person get-together twice per year where we spend the time strategizing planning as well as just talking having fun and getting to know each other better. Last time we did this was in Tuscany and prior to that it was on a beach in Portugal!

title: Designer dApp Mobile ( UX/UI )
description:
*** FRENCH SPEAKING ONLY ***Hello 👋On recrute un UX/UI designer spécialisé dans la conception dapplication mobile :
Full remote
30-40k/annuel
100% not boring : travailler sur des projets différents chaque semaine
Perks : Abonnement spotify excellente complémentaire santé tickets restos financement co-working / matériel.

🦄 Être payé à faire des shots DribbbleD’un côté les entrepreneurs ont besoin de montrer des concepts d’applications qui donnent envie pour lever des fonds.De l’autre côté nous UX/UI designers on aime pouvoir se lâcher sur des petits projets. Ne pas être contraint par un design system existant la tech la data ou encore nos collègues.Avouons-le nous l’excitation des débuts de projet c’est une vraie drogue créative. Mais lorsqu’on passe plusieurs semaines voir plusieurs mois sur les mêmes problématiques on a souvent qu’une hâte. Se replonger dans de nouveaux challenges.C’est ça Bootnow : une agence spécialisé dans la conception de concept et MVP pour les startups.🎯 Notre objectifPermettre aux entrepreneurs de mettre en lumière leurs idées rapidement.Créer une petite bulle de paradis pour les designers dans laquelle ils pourront développer leur creative skills 🎨Profil recherchéCurieuxTu t’intéresses à de nouveaux sujets régulièrement. Si tu ne connais pas quelquechose ton réflexe c’est cash d’aller voir sur Google.Passionné par le design et la techQuand tu télécharges une nouvelle application tu ne peux pas tempêcher de tester toutes les fonctionnalités. Au restaurant tu regardes plus la typo que les plâts sur la carte.Capacité découte et de synthèseTu aimes discuter avec les gens tu t’intéresses à eux et tu es capable de synthétiser et résumer ce qu’ils te racontent. Tu es force de proposition tout en restant humble : les bonnes idées peuvent venir de nimporte qui.Copier/CollerTu ne cherches pas à réinventer la roue à chaque projet t’es capable d’aller trouver des solutions qui fonctionnent et les adapter au projet sur lequel tu bosses.FigmaTu ponces le raccourcis maj + A comme personne.Design systemTu connais la majeure partie des patterns/composants web et mobiles et tu sais comment les utiliser au sein d’un design system.Bonnes pratiques UXTu as une bonne intuition quand tu prends une application en main tu arrives tout de suite à sentir les choses qui ne vont pas et tu es capable de proposer des améliorations.

title: Grafik-Designer | E-Commerce (m/w/d)
description:
Wir bei OutdoorHeld einem E-Commerce Start-Up aus Österreich sind auf einer Mission den Schuhmarkt mit unseren innovativen Barfußschuhen zu revolutionieren! Unser Ziel ist es dabei den Schritt in ein schmerzfreies gesundes Leben zu ermöglichen. Als Teil unseres Teams kannst du in einem kreativen lernorientierten und teambasierten harmonischen Arbeitsumfeld mitwirken und dein volles Potential in deinem Bereich ausschöpfen. Wir setzen gemeinsam im Team ein Zeichen für mehr Gesundheit und Wohlbefinden um den Menschen ein schmerzfreies aktives und genussvolles Leben zu schenken!Aufgaben
Erstellung von Facebook/Instagram Picture Ads (Direct Response): Erstelle ansprechende und wirkungsvolle Direct Response Picture Ads die auf sozialen Medien herausstechen.
Gestaltung von YouTube Thumbnails für Google Ads: Kreiere fesselnde Thumbnails die Klicks generieren und unsere Online-Präsenz stärken.
Erstellung von Outro-Grafiken für Video Ads: Designe faszinierende Outros die unsere Markenbotschaft in Videoanzeigen wirksam übermitteln.
Design von Social Media Posts: Entwirf kreative und visuell ansprechende Beiträge die unsere Follower auf sozialen Medien begeistern.
Konzeption von E-Mail Grafiken (Header Banner): Gestalte einzigartige Grafiken für E-Mail-Marketing-Kampagnen die Aufmerksamkeit erregen und zum Lesen anregen.
Erarbeitung von Grafiken für unseren Online-Store: Entwickle ästhetische und funktionale Grafiken die unsere Produkte im Online-Store optimal präsentieren.
Grafische Gestaltung von Produktbeschreibungen: Erstelle visuell ansprechende Grafiken die unsere Produktbeschreibungen ergänzen und den Verkauf fördern.
Qualifikation
Erfahrung im E-Commerce/Direct Response Marketing: Kenntnisse in der Gestaltung von Grafiken die speziell auf die Bedürfnisse von E-Commerce und Direct Response Marketing abgestimmt sind.
Kompetenz in Design-Software: Sicherer Umgang mit Grafik-Software wie Canva Photoshop Illustrator um hochwertige Grafiken zu erstellen.
Kenntnisse über Social Media Plattformen: Verständnis für spezifische Anforderungen verschiedener Social Media Plattformen einschließlich Bildformaten und Safe-Zones.
Kreativität und Innovation: Fähigkeit originelle und auffällige Designs zu kreieren.
Auge für Details: Genauigkeit und Sorgfalt in der Ausarbeitung von Designs.
Zeitmanagement und Organisation: Fähigkeit Projekte fristgerecht und effizient abzuschließen.
Benefits
Berufliche Weiterbildung: Gelegenheit zur kontinuierlichen Weiterbildung und Förderung in deinem Fachbereich.
Kreativer Freiraum: Möglichkeit eigene Ideen umzusetzen und künstlerische Fähigkeiten einzubringen.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Homeoffice: Flexibilität in der Arbeitsgestaltung einschließlich der Möglichkeit von zu Hause aus zu arbeiten.
Remote-Arbeit von überall aus: Freiheit von verschiedenen Orten aus zu arbeiten.
Projektvielfalt: Abwechslungsreiche Projekte und Herausforderungen.
Technologiezugang: Zugriff auf Design-Tools und Software.
Junges & dynamisches Team: Du bist Teil einer Familie in der großer Fokus auf ein lernorientiertes und teambasiertes harmonisches Arbeitsumfeld gelegt wird.
Work-Life-Balance: Unterstützung eines ausgewogenen Verhältnisses zwischen Beruf und Privatleben.
Das alles klingt spannend und interessant für Dich? Dann bewirb dich jetzt in nur wenigen Schritten und werde vielleicht schon bald Teil unserer OutdoorHeld-Family! Wir freuen uns schon dich bald kennenlernen zu dürfen und gemeinsam mit dir diese Reise zu bestreiten!

title: Senior Web Designer
description:

A design trailblazer unafraid to break the mold.
